page.title: 09CHANGING TIMES-COALISLAND 5
page.content: Grandfather and his friends made their games from the chestnuts on the trees and the sticks in the hedge. They played marbles which we still play today but their 'toys' were hand-made. {Stilts}were made from two tins (usually syrup) and string attached -they walked on these. They made {catapults}from a Y-shaped piece of wood and used pieces of rubber from old bicycle tyres for the stretchy part. I can still make a catapult. The older folk {ceilied}in each other's houses at night, telling yarns and ghost stories. There were no T.V.s or videos to spoil their conversations and when the candles burned low or the {paraffin}was done in the{tilly-lamps} they sat in the glow of the fire. My grandfather says times were hard but there was less violence, vandalism or dissatisfaction which exists today.
